analysis.Summary: Vue component for selecting a city. It displays the current city, a list of upcoming cities, and a contact link, with support for i18n and emits an event to close its parent popup.
analysis.Purpose: Provides a UI partial for users to choose their city within the application, typically rendered inside a modal or popup.

Components.name: CitySelection
Components.role: Main component that renders the city selection interface and handles close-popup emission.

Functions.name: closePopup
Functions.description: Emits the 'close-popup' event to notify the parent to close this component's popup.

analysis.Usage: Imported wherever a city selection modal is needed. The parent passes `isPopupOpen` and listens for the `close-popup` event. Example: <CitySelection :isPopupOpen="open" @close-popup="handleClose"/>.
Notes: Static text and city lists are defined locally in the `text` object passed to useI18n; no dynamic data source.
Imports `computed` and `onMounted` but these are not used in the current implementation.
Simple SCSS rule only sets max-width on the container.
Props and emits follow the Vue 3 <script setup> convention.
